tasks.task: Conducting Field Trials for Furrow Irrigation System Design
subtasks: Identify representative furrows for the trial segment
Select a range of extreme stream sizes for testing (e.g., low and high)
Measure the advance time of water from upstream to downstream ends
Plot advance curves for different stream sizes to visualize their behavior
Determine the maximum allowable non-erosive stream size
Compare the empirically determined maximum stream size with initial theoretical prediction
Adjust field length parameters using iterative procedures (e.g., changing length to achieve desired advance time)
Evaluate the relationship between field length, advance time, and efficient non-erosive flow

tasks.task: Verifying Level Basin System Design Parameters
subtasks: Determine the appropriate unit stream size for the intended soil type and basin area
Calculate the net depth of infiltration using the desired time of infiltration and family curve relationships
Assess distribution pattern efficiency (FAR) and extract corresponding advance time (Tt)
Calculate the length of the basin required for the selected flow rate and unit stream size
Consider variations in soil type and infiltration rates when determining basin area and depth
Check for cutoff time (TCO) requirements and adjust D_max accordingly if necessary
Evaluate the time of advance (Tt) versus cutoff time (TCO) to determine safe operating parameters
Confirm the maximum depth of flow (D_max) in the basin, ensuring adequate ridge height for water retention
